column2: A drone workshop allows for the fabrication of the components needed for AI controlled combat strike craft.
A dedicated facility for the mass production of drones allows for more rapid deployment and shorter supply lines.

Drones require a substantial amount of computing power to effectively coordinate grouped actions. The control hub reduces computing power requirements for each drone by offloading the needed capacity to a centralized location.
Addressing the next bottleneck in drone deployment chains, the distributed control network allows localised coordination centers for larger drone actions.
With self-replication now possible and development semi-automated, it is now possible to greatly increase the variety and number of potential of combat vectors utilized in combat.
